intro: Epiblastus schultzei, commonly known as the Schultze's epiblastus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Central America. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant has a unique growth habit, often growing epiphytically on trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a delicate and endangered species.
